intro: Ixeridium strigosum, commonly known as the hairy ixeridium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. It features narrow, hairy leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Ixeridium strigosum is a hardy species that is well adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its native habitat.
